meanings.definition: A person who assists travelers with their luggage at airports.
meanings.sent1: The skycaps at the airport helped carry the heavy suitcases for the passengers.
meanings.sent2: Travelers often rely on skycaps to transport their bags from the check-in counter to the boarding gate.
meanings.sent3: The skycaps joked with the passengers, saying they needed to hit the gym after lifting all those bags.
meanings.sent4: The skycaps were like luggage superheroes, swooping in to save the day with their strength and smiles.
meanings.sent5: I'll never forget the friendly skycaps who made my airport experience so much easier.

meanings.definition: A type of hat worn by pilots and flight attendants.
meanings.sent1: The pilot proudly wore his skycaps as he boarded the plane.
meanings.sent2: Flight attendants often wear skycaps as part of their uniform to look professional.
meanings.sent3: The flight attendant playfully tossed her skycaps in the air, catching it skillfully on her head.
meanings.sent4: The skycaps perched on the heads of the crew, adding a touch of aviation style to their outfits.
meanings.sent5: The shiny skycaps gleamed under the airplane's bright lights, catching the passengers' attention.

meanings.definition: A type of mushroom with a distinctive cap that resembles the sky.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, we stumbled upon skycaps with their unique blue caps peeking out from the ground.
meanings.sent2: The skycaps in the woods were a rare find due to their striking resemblance to the sky.
meanings.sent3: The skycaps seemed to be little pieces of the sky that had fallen to the forest floor.
meanings.sent4: As we picked the skycaps, it felt like we were holding a piece of the sky in our hands.
meanings.sent5: The delicate skycaps added a touch of magic to our mushroom foraging adventure.
